title: Glynn’s Take: Raising RBA Bond Purchases a Break-Glass Option Only
sub_head: Purchases of bonds under the RBA’s quantitative easing program were meant to be dialed down in September
body:
It isn’t too far off the mark to picture the Reserve Bank of Australia’s governor, Philip Lowe, in the wheel house of a creaking machine called the economy, surrounded by hissing pressure gauges, levers and pulley systems.
With every adjustment of the policy dials, Mr. Lowe is trying to smooth economic cycles, build confidence, create jobs, and if at all possible, keep the economy from toppling into the abyss.
